page.title: 07UNUSUAL FEATURES IN WILDEN.
page.content: At the East End of Wilden village lies a large {reservoir,}constructed by one of the farmers after the 1976 drought. Strictly private but tempting to young swimmers. Coming towards the village one passes the {Boarding Kennels}- not a popular place with local residents in summer time. On the hill towards Colmworth is a { {Cattery,}somewhat quieter than the kennels. Tucked out of sight in the Barford Road is the {Baptist Chapel. A pack of{Beagle Hounds }is kept at the opposite end of the village -almost unnoticed. {Horse riding}is a popular pastime, with many families owning their own horses. A {Post Office }was housed at the back of the local pub, but sadly it closed last month.
